contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox anthem |title = འབྲུག་ཙན་དན་ |transcription = Druk tsendhen |english_title = The Thunder Dragon Kingdom |image = Bhutan emblem.svg |image_size = |prefix = National |country = {{BTN}} |author = [[Dasho Gyaldun Thinley]] |lyrics_date = |composer = [[Aku Tongmi]] |music_date = |adopted = 1953 |sound = |sound_title = }} '''Druk tsendhen''' ("The Thunder Dragon Kingdom") is the [[national anthem]] of [[Bhutan]]. Adopted in 1953, the music is by [[Aku Tongmi]] and the words are by Dasho [[Gyaldun Thinley]].<ref>{{cite book|title=Hrvatska Enciklopedija |volume=1 |first=Dalibor |last=Brozović |publisher=Miroslav Krleža |year=1999 |isbn=953-6036-29-0 |page=569 |url=http://books.google.com/books?id=ewUTAQAAMAAJ |accessdate=2011-10-29}}</ref> Tongmi was educated in [[India]] and had recently been appointed leader of the military brass band when the need for an anthem rose at the occasion of a state visit from Prime Minister [[Jawaharlal Nehru]] of India. His original score was inspired by the Bhutanese folk tune "The Unchanging Lotus Throne" (''Thri nyampa med pa pemai thri''). The melody has twice undergone changes by Tongmi's successors as band leaders. The original lyrics were 12 lines, but was shortened to the present six-line version in 1964 by a secretary to the king.<ref name=CBS1>{{cite book|title=The Origin and Description of The National Flag and National Anthem of The Kingdom of Bhutan |first1=Dorji |last1=Penjore |first2=Sonam |last2=Kinga |publisher=The Centre for Bhutan Studies |location=[[Thimphu]] |year=2002 |url=http://www.bhutanstudies.org.bt/pubFiles/nationalflag.pdf |format=PDF |page=14 |isbn=99936-14-01-7 |accessdate=2011-04-19}}</ref> As the anthem is inspired by a folk tune, there is a choreography to it as well, originally directed by Tongmi.<ref name=CBS1/><ref>{{cite book|title=Independence Days: Holidays and Celebrations |first=Amy Hackney |last=Blackwell |publisher=Infobase Publishing |accessdate=2011-10-29}}</ref>||Transliteration||English translation |- |width="30%"| འབྲུག་ཙན་དན་བཀོད་པའི་རྒྱལ་ཁབ་ནང་།།<br> དཔལ་ལུགས་གཉིས་བསྟན་སྲིད་སྐྱོང་བའི་མགོན་།།<br> འབྲུག་རྒྱལ་པོ་མངའ་བདག་རིན་པོ་ཆེ་།།<br> སྐུ་འགྱུར་མེད་བརྟན་ཅིང་ཆབ་སྲིད་འཕེལ་།།<br> ཆོས་སངས་རྒྱས་བསྟན་པ་དར་ཞིང་རྒྱས་།།<br> འབངས་བདེ་སྐྱིད་ཉི་མ་ཤར་བར་ཤོག་།། |width="30%"| [[Druk]] tsenden koepei gyelkhap na<br> Pyel loog nig tyensi chongwei gyen<br> Druk gyelpo ngadak rinpoche<br> Koo jurmey tyentsing chap tsid pyel<br> Che sangye tyenpa darshing gyel<br> Bang deykyed nyima sha-wa sho. |width="40%"| In the Kingdom of Druk, where cypresses grow,<br> Refuge of the glorious monastic and civil traditions,<br> The King of Druk, precious sovereign,<br> His being is eternal, his reign prosperous,<br>
